top_categories.workout_context: Racing Finnish Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
At 110 miles, Finnish Gravel punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Finnish Gravel’s well-maintained gravel roads, forest paths demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Finnish Gravel’s fast-rolling finnish gravel roads through unesco geopark and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Finnish Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Finnish Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Finnish Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on fast-rolling finnish gravel roads through unesco geopark.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Finnish Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Finnish Gravel’s fast-rolling finnish gravel roads through unesco geopark delivers on race day.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Finnish Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
At 110 miles, Finnish Gravel rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Every session at Finnish Gravel intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Finnish Gravel’s 110 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Finnish Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on fast-rolling finnish gravel roads through unesco geopark to build confidence. Expect: well-maintained gravel roads, forest paths, nordic ski trails.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Durability, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 110 miles of fast-rolling finnish gravel roads through unesco geopark in Lahti, Paijanne Tavastia, Finland.
